overview: Ting's hometown was far away, but now she had made her home on Nam Kok Road (meaning "The Southern End") in Kowloon City. Ting wanted to go around and know the area. The various trivial things she saw on the streets invoked many inner thoughts and monologues in her. When the night came, she wrote down “words about staying”. While she was wandering on the street, she walked past countless walls of silence where time had left marks on.
title: The Southern End
